org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.openstack
Class OpenstackCloudDriver

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.CloudDriverSupport
      org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.openstack.OpenstackCloudDriver
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProvisioningDriver
Deprecated. 

public class OpenstackCloudDriver
extends CloudDriverSupport
implements ProvisioningDriver

A custom cloud driver for OpenStack, using keystone authentication. In order to be able to define a floating IP for a machine Changes will have to be made in the cloud driver. a floating ip should be allocated and attached to the server in the newServer method, and detach and deleted upon machine shutdown.

Since:
2.1
Author:
barakme

Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Called once on startup of the cloud driver, passing the cloud configuration to it.

Specified by:
setConfig in interface ProvisioningDriver
Overrides:
setConfig in class CloudDriverSupport
Parameters:

templateName - The template required for this cloud driver.
management - true if this driver will launch management machines, false otherwise.
serviceName - The name of the service that is planned to be installed on this machine. Could be null if this is a management machine hosting more than one service

startMachine

public MachineDetails startMachine(String locationId,
                                   long duration,
                                   TimeUnit unit)
                            throws TimeoutException,
                                   CloudProvisioningException
Deprecated. 
Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Starts an additional machine on the cloud , on the specific location, to scale out this specific service. In case of an error while provisioning the machine, any allocated resources should be freed before throwing a CloudProvisioningException or TimeoutException to the caller.

Specified by:
startMachine in interface ProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
locationId - the location to allocate the machine to.
duration - Time duration to wait for the instance.
unit - Time unit to wait for the instance.
Returns:
The details of the started instance.
Throws:
TimeoutException - In case the instance was not started in the allotted time.
CloudProvisioningException - If a problem was encountered while starting the machine.
